actor_awards.notes: A legendary Broadway dancer and actress who won four Tony Awards. She was a muse and collaborator for choreographer Bob Fosse. While primarily a stage star, she had memorable roles in films like 'Damn Yankees' and 'Cocoon'.

filmography.title: Damn Yankees
filmography.role_description: The Devil's seductive assistant who is tasked with seducing a baseball player, famously singing 'Whatever Lola Wants'.
filmography.plot: A baseball fan sells his soul to the Devil to become the slugger who helps the Washington Senators win the pennant against the New York Yankees.

filmography.title: Cocoon
filmography.role_description: A resident of a retirement home who, along with her friends, discovers a pool charged with alien energy that rejuvenates them.
filmography.plot: A group of elderly people in a retirement home get a new lease on life when they trespass in a swimming pool containing alien cocoons.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Marvin's Room
filmography.role_description: The soap-opera-addicted aunt of the main characters who provides comic relief and warmth in a dysfunctional family.
filmography.plot: A woman with leukemia attempts to reconnect with her estranged sister and nephews in hopes of finding a bone marrow donor.
filmography.awards: Screen Actors Guild: Nomination – Outstanding Performance by a Cast

filmography.title: The Cotton Club
filmography.role_description: The mother of the main character, Dixie Dwyer, in this stylish crime drama set in 1930s Harlem.
filmography.plot: Musicians and gangsters cross paths at the famous Cotton Club in 1930s Harlem.

filmography.title: Alice
filmography.role_description: The mother of the title character in this woody Allen fantasy-comedy.
filmography.plot: A wealthy Manhattan housewife visits an herbalist who gives her potions that allow her to see her life and relationships more clearly.

filmography.title: Cocoon: The Return
filmography.role_description: Bess returns to Earth with her friends to visit their families, facing the decision of whether to stay or return to the alien planet.
filmography.plot: The seniors who left Earth for the planet Antarea return to visit their loved ones, but discover that their home is not as they left it.

filmography.title: Nadine
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this comedy-thriller set in 1950s Texas.
filmography.plot: A hairdresser in 1954 Austin, Texas, witnesses a murder while trying to retrieve nude photos of herself.

filmography.title: Walking Across Egypt
filmography.role_description: A neighbor and friend to the main character, an elderly widow who befriends a juvenile delinquent.
filmography.plot: An elderly widow takes in a wayward teenager, much to the dismay of her children and neighbors.

filmography.title: Bruno
filmography.role_description: Verdon's final film role, appearing in this comedy about a unique young boy.
filmography.plot: An androgynous boy fights for his individuality against a private Catholic school and his own mother.

filmography.title: On the Riviera
filmography.role_description: A featured dancer in this musical comedy starring Danny Kaye.
filmography.plot: A nightclub entertainer impersonates a philandering French aviator, causing confusion for the aviator's wife and his own girlfriend.

filmography.title: David and Bathsheba
filmography.role_description: A dancer performing in the biblical epic, showcasing her early career skills.
filmography.plot: King David of Israel falls in love with the wife of one of his captains, leading to tragic consequences.

filmography.title: The Mississippi Gambler
filmography.role_description: A featured dancer performing a voodoo-inspired routine.
filmography.plot: An honest gambler tries to run a crooked game on a Mississippi riverboat and falls for an aristocratic Southern belle.

filmography.title: The Farmer Takes a Wife
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this musical remake set on the Erie Canal.
filmography.plot: A farmer working on the Erie Canal falls in love with a cook, but their romance is threatened by a rival.

filmography.title: Meet Me After the Show
filmography.role_description: A dancer appearing in the musical numbers alongside Betty Grable.
filmography.plot: A Broadway star discovers her husband is having an affair and fakes amnesia to win him back.

filmography.title: The I Don't Care Girl
filmography.role_description: A dancer in the biographical musical about Eva Tanguay.
filmography.plot: A film producer searches for the truth about the life of vaudeville star Eva Tanguay.

filmography.title: Gentlemen Marry Brunettes
filmography.role_description: A dancer in the sequel to 'Gentlemen Prefer Blondes'.
filmography.plot: Two sisters travel to Paris to find rich husbands and perform in the Folies Bergère.

filmography.title: Oldest Living Confederate Widow Tells All
filmography.role_description: A nursing home resident and friend to the main character in this acclaimed TV movie.
filmography.plot: An elderly woman in a nursing home recounts her life story, including her marriage to a Confederate veteran.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Supporting Actress (Cicely Tyson)

filmography.title: Best Friends for Life
filmography.role_description: A wealthy widow who forms a friendship with another widow in this TV movie.
filmography.plot: Two widows from different backgrounds become roommates and best friends, helping each other navigate life and romance.

filmography.title: Legs
filmography.role_description: A former Rockette who helps a group of women become a chorus line. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A group of women audition to become Radio City Music Hall Rockettes.

filmography.title: The Jerk, Too
filmography.role_description: A small comedic role in this television sequel to 'The Jerk'. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Navin Johnson leaves home again to find his fortune and true love in the big city.

filmography.title: In Cold Blood
filmography.role_description: The local postmistress in this miniseries adaptation of Truman Capote's book.
filmography.plot: A retelling of the brutal murder of a Kansas family and the subsequent investigation and trial of the killers.

filmography.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance in the musical film based on the Beatles album.
filmography.plot: A small-town band hits it big but must battle the music industry and evil forces to save their town.

filmography.title: Dreamboat
filmography.role_description: An uncredited dancer role in this comedy about silent films.
filmography.plot: A college professor's past as a silent film star is revealed when his old movies are shown on television.

filmography.title: Magnum, P.I.
filmography.role_description: Magnum's mother, appearing in several episodes of the hit series. (TV Series)
filmography.plot: The adventures of a private investigator living in Hawaii.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Guest Performer in a Drama Series

filmography.title: Alice
filmography.role_description: Appeared in a musical-themed episode of the sitcom.
filmography.plot: A widow moves to Phoenix with her son and becomes a waitress at Mel's Diner.
